alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 8:43AM CST until February 07 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County. .Flooding continues on the Catoma Creek and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands in the vicinity of the U.S. 331 Highway Bridge occurs. At 24.0 feet, Residential and street flooding becomes a problem... and increases rapidly above 24 feet. Several residences are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 23.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. This is 1 foot below moderate flood stage. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
